intro: Melampyrum ovalifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaved touch-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it partially relies on other plants for water and nutrients through its root system. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikes, often displaying a range of colors from yellow to orange. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
